Pension Schemes (Conversion of Guaranteed Minimum Pensions) Act 2022
2022 CHAPTER 33
An Act to make provision about the amendment of pension schemes so as toprovide for the conversion of rights to a guaranteed minimum pension.
[28th April 2022]

Be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the adviceand consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this presentParliament assembled, and by the authority of the same, as follows:—
Conversion of guaranteed minimum pensions
The Pension Schemes Act 1993 is amended in accordance with subsections (2)to (9).
In section 24A (conversion of guaranteed minimum pension into otherbenefits: introduction), in subsection (1)—
omit paragraph (a);
for paragraph (b) substitute—
“GMP conversion” means—
the amendment of a scheme in relation to an earner who was aliveimmediately before the conversion date so that it no longer contains the rulesspecified in sections 13(1)(a) and (b) and 17(1), or

the amendment of a scheme in relation to a person who, immediately beforethe conversion date, was the widow, widower or surviving civil partner of anearner so that it no longer contains the rules specified in section 17(1),”;
after that paragraph insert—
“P” means—
in relation to a GMP conversion within paragraph (b)(i), the earnermentioned in that provision;
in relation to a GMP conversion within paragraph (b)(ii), the survivormentioned in that provision,”;
omit paragraph (c);
in paragraphs (e) and (f)—
after “scheme” insert “in relation to P”;
omit “(disregarding money purchase benefits)”.
In section 24B (the conversion conditions)—
in subsection (2), after “benefits” (in both places it occurs) insert“(disregarding money purchase benefits)”;
in subsection (3), for “the earner” substitute “P”;
for subsection (5) substitute—
Condition 4 is that, in the case of a GMP conversion within section24A(1)(b)(i) (GMP conversion in relation to earner)—
the converted scheme provides benefits to or in respect of any widow,widower or surviving civil partner of P, and
such conditions as may be prescribed are met in relation to thosebenefits.”;
in subsection (7)—
in the opening words, omit “in respect of an earner”;
in paragraph (a), for “in respect of other earners” substitute “inrelation to persons other than P”;
in paragraph (b), for “the earner” substitute “P”.
Omit section 24D (survivors’ benefits).
In section 24E (procedural requirements)—
in subsection (2), for “The employer” substitute “Each relevant person (ifany)”;
after subsection (2) insert—
“(2A)For the purposes of subsection (2) a person is “relevant” in relation toa scheme if such conditions as may be prescribed are met in relation to theperson and the scheme.”;
in subsection (3)(a), for “the earner” substitute “P”;
omit subsection (4).
In section 24F (transfer out)—
in subsection (1), in paragraphs (a) and (b), for “earner’s accrued rightsunder a GMP-converted scheme” substitute “accrued rights of a person inrelation to whom GMP conversion has been effected”;
omit subsection (2);
for subsection (3) substitute—
Where—
a member of a scheme makes an application under section 95(1), and
GMP conversion has not been effected in relation to the member,

the trustees may with the member’s consent adjust any cash equivalent so as toreflect rights that would have accrued if GMP conversion had been effected inrelation to the member in accordance with Conditions 1 to 4 of section 24B.”
In section 24G (powers to amend schemes)—
in subsection (1), omit “(whether in relation to present earners,pensioners or survivors)”;
omit subsection (5).
In section 38A (regulations about relevant gender change cases)—
in subsection (1), omit paragraph (b) (but not the “or” at the end);
in subsection (3), omit paragraph (b) (but not the “or” at the end);
in subsection (6), in the opening words, omit “, 24D”.

In section 47 (further provisions concerning entitlement to guaranteedminimum pensions for the purposes of section 46), in subsection (9), for thewords from “the amendment” to the end substitute “GMP conversion (within themeaning given by section 24A(1)) in relation to the person”.
In the Pensions Act 2007, in section 14 (conversion of guaranteed minimumpensions)—
in subsection (8)(c), after “conversion” insert “in relation to theperson”;
in subsection (8)(d), after “conversion” insert “in relation to theperson”;
in subsection (10), after “conversion” insert “in relation to S”;
in subsection (11), omit “inserted by subsection (3) above”.
In the Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Act 2013, in Schedule 4 (effect ofextension of marriage: further provisions), omit paragraph 21.
In the Pension Schemes Act 2015, in section 81 (extension to Scotland ofcertain provisions about marriage of same sex couples), omit “24D(5),”.
Conversion of guaranteed minimum pensions: Northern Ireland
The Pension Schemes (Northern Ireland) Act 1993 is amended in accordancewith subsections (2) to (9).
In section 20A (conversion of guaranteed minimum pension into otherbenefits: introduction), in subsection (1)—
omit paragraph (a);
for paragraph (b) substitute—
“GMP conversion” means—
the amendment of a scheme in relation to an earner who was aliveimmediately before the conversion date so that it no longer contains the rulesspecified in sections 9(1)(a) and (b) and 13(1), or

the amendment of a scheme in relation to a person who, immediately beforethe conversion date, was the widow, widower or surviving civil partner of anearner so that it no longer contains the rules specified in section 13(1),”;
after that paragraph insert—
“P” means—
in relation to a GMP conversion within paragraph (b)(i), the earnermentioned in that provision;
in relation to a GMP conversion within paragraph (b)(ii), the survivormentioned in that provision,”;
omit paragraph (c);
in paragraphs (e) and (f)—
after “scheme” insert “in relation to P”;
omit “(disregarding money purchase benefits)”.
In section 20B (the conversion conditions)—
in subsection (2), after “benefits” (in both places it occurs) insert“(disregarding money purchase benefits)”;
in subsection (3), for “the earner” substitute “P”;
for subsection (5) substitute—
Condition 4 is that, in the case of a GMP conversion within section20A(1)(b)(i) (GMP conversion in relation to earner)—
the converted scheme provides benefits to or in respect of any widow,widower or surviving civil partner of P, and
such conditions as may be prescribed are met in relation to thosebenefits.”;
in subsection (7)—
in the opening words, omit “in respect of an earner”;
in paragraph (a), for “in respect of other earners” substitute “inrelation to persons other than P”;
in paragraph (b), for “the earner” substitute “P”.
Omit section 20D (survivors’ benefits).
In section 20E (procedural requirements)—
in subsection (2), for “The employer” substitute “Each relevant person (ifany)”;
after subsection (2) insert—
“(2A)For the purposes of subsection (2) a person is “relevant” in relation toa scheme if such conditions as may be prescribed are met in relation to theperson and the scheme.”;
in subsection (3)(a), for “the earner” substitute “P”;
omit subsection (4).
In section 20F (transfer out)—
in subsection (1), in paragraphs (a) and (b), for “earner’s accrued rightsunder a GMP-converted scheme” substitute “accrued rights of a person inrelation to whom GMP conversion has been effected”;
omit subsection (2);
for subsection (3) substitute—
Where—
a member of a scheme makes an application under section 91(1), and
GMP conversion has not been effected in relation to the member,

the trustees may with the member’s consent adjust any cash equivalent so as toreflect rights that would have accrued if GMP conversion had been effected inrelation to the member in accordance with Conditions 1 to 4 of section 20B.”
In section 20G (powers to amend schemes)—
in subsection (1), omit “(whether in relation to present earners,pensioners or survivors)”;
omit subsection (5).
In section 34A (regulations about relevant gender change cases)—
in subsection (1), omit paragraph (b) (but not the “or” at the end);
in subsection (3), omit paragraph (b) (but not the “or” at the end);
in subsection (6), in the opening words, omit “, 20D”.

In section 43 (further provisions concerning entitlement to guaranteedminimum pensions for the purposes of section 42), in subsection (9), for thewords from “the amendment” to the end substitute “GMP conversion (within themeaning given by section 20A(1)) in relation to the person”.
In the [Pensions Act (Northern Ireland) 2008 (c. 1(N.I.))](/id/nia/2008/1?view=plain "Go to item of legislation"), in section 12(conversion of guaranteed minimum pensions)—
in subsection (8)(c), after “conversion” insert “in relation to theperson”;
in subsection (8)(d), after “conversion” insert “in relation to theperson”;
in subsection (10), after “conversion” insert “in relation to S”;
in subsection (11), omit “inserted by subsection (3)”.
Extent, commencement and short title
Section 1 extends to England and Wales and Scotland.
Section 2 extends to Northern Ireland.
This section extends to England and Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland.
The following come into force on the day on which this Act is passed—
section 1 for the purposes of making regulations under the Pension SchemesAct 1993;
section 2 for the purposes of making regulations under the Pension Schemes(Northern Ireland) Act 1993;
this section.
Section 1 comes into force for remaining purposes on such day or days asthe Secretary of State may by regulations appoint.
Section 2 comes into force for remaining purposes on such day or days asthe Department for Communities in Northern Ireland may by order appoint.
The Secretary of State may by regulations make transitional or savingprovision in connection with the coming into force of section 1.
The Department for Communities in Northern Ireland may by order maketransitional or saving provision in connection with the coming into force ofsection 2.
Regulations made by the Secretary of State under this section are to bemade by statutory instrument.

The power of the Department for Communities in Northern Ireland to make anorder under subsection (6) or (8) is exercisable by statutory rule for thepurposes of the Statutory Rules (Northern Ireland) Order 1979 ([S.I. 1979/1573(N.I. 12)](/id/nisi/1979/1573?view=plain "Go to item of legislation")).
This Act may be cited as the Pension Schemes (Conversion of GuaranteedMinimum Pensions) Act 2022.
